intro: Lunathyrium conilii var. angustatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its white, star-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and supporting local wildlife.
